meanings.definition: Exies (noun): informal term for Australian currency, especially the Australian dollar.
meanings.sent1: I used my exies to buy a new book at the store.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged her exies for some euros before traveling.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was full of exies, making it heavy to carry around.
meanings.sent4: His wallet was overflowing with exies, a sign of his hard work paying off.
meanings.sent5: The cashier counted the exies carefully before handing over the change.

meanings.definition: Exies (verb): to leave or exit a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: After the movie ended, we decided to exies the theater quickly.
meanings.sent2: He exies the party early to catch the last bus home.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to exies the room through the window but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The students exies the classroom in a rush when the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: She always exies the conversation when it turns to politics.

meanings.definition: Exies (adjective): relating to or characteristic of the 1990s.
meanings.sent1: Her exies fashion sense included baggy jeans and crop tops.
meanings.sent2: The exies music playing at the party brought back nostalgic memories.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bring back exies slang, but his friends didn't understand.
meanings.sent4: The exies style of the room was a hit at the retro-themed party.
meanings.sent5: The exies vibe of the cafe made it a popular spot for millennials.
